content.text:
What a coincidence, we all agree! I think this thread has split into two:

My original question was moreso [meant to be] based around the etymology of the "of America" bit, because I'd rather drop that suffix unless it's actually necessary or more correct. I should have asked "What's the diffeerence between the US and the USA?". I think [@aramiscd.1](@Dlz2W4RJ57h4AJPjac09Z0sLUMmIH94J7XoZLCIWq3M=.ed25519) and [@Lenny](@AsA9DgDDdO24c4FFIbuE9LB3b1xFTzHVn6AKArWnS+o=.ed25519) touched on this a bit, although I'd still love to hear more input.

Just in case my opinions on borders are unclear:

![crimethinc borders the global caste system](&aXDuuApWFolE4fTW3WgC95t2cEUXxw1mrOBvduhiiG8=.sha256)

I supposed I should probably start saying that I live in the [Cascadia bioregion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cascadia_(bioregion) in the [Willamette River watershed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Willamette_River#Watershed).

mentions.name: crimethinc borders the global caste system
